definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: Netbooks are a hot-selling consumer product.
sentences.chinese: 网簿是一类热销的消费品。

sentences.english: The popular Toyota Prius, for example, is not yet manufactured in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 例如，热销的丰田普拉斯还未在美国投产。

sentences.english: Now mostly sheep blankets comparison of sell like hot cakes.
sentences.chinese: 现多数是羊毛毡比较热销。

sentences.english: American super best-selling author Dan brown new novel.
sentences.chinese: 美国超等热销书作家丹布朗新小说。

sentences.english: “Forever” multiple speed racing bicycles are sure to be sellable in your market.
sentences.chinese: “永久”牌变速赛车在您的市场中一定热销。

sentences.english: Most sheep are felt more selling.
sentences.chinese: 现多数是羊毛毡比较热销。

sentences.english: This mattress sells pretty well and this promotion ends tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 这种床垫很热销，这次的促销活动明天就截止了。

sentences.english: Maintaining the Cruze's sales momentum won't be easy, though.
sentences.chinese: 不过，要保持克鲁兹的热销势头并非易事。

sentences.english: The product suddenly took off in September.
sentences.chinese: 该产品在九月份突然热销起来。

sentences.english: Fuzhou, xiamen, fujian's low ink orchid every year before.
sentences.chinese: 福建厦门福州的低价墨兰每年春节前一直热销。

sentences.english: Our products are exported to Europe, America, Middle-east and Asian countries widely.
sentences.chinese: 凯高产品广泛地热销到欧洲，美洲，中东及亚洲各国。

sentences.english: "HONO" is one of the hot brands of Badi products which has been authorized the international registered trade mark.
sentences.chinese: 是巴迪热销品牌之一，并取得了国际注册商标。

sentences.english: In kunming, yunnan has double light meal Atlantic last year.
sentences.chinese: 云南昆明的莲瓣兰大小雪素去年一直热销。

definition: to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to hit the market (of a new product)
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
to sell out/to run out (of supplies)/deficient/lack of supplies
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
kingpin (vehicle part)/to focus one's marketing efforts on (a region, product etc)
advance sale/to sell in advance/to book
to be completely sold out/to sell out
